did.unittitle: Accounts, 1777-1778, with the Board of War
did.abstract: These accounts include entries for labor, barrels, wagon hire, freight, powder, muskets, bayonets, balls, cartridges and cartridge paper, and powder horns. Also includes some entries of the character of a commonplace book. On the back cover is a poem written to David Rittenhouse, from Charles Willson Peale.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: The St. George Peale Collection consists of a single, small volume that primarily contains the military accounts of St. George Peale during 1777. St. George was Charles Willson Peale’s brother who lived in Maryland and served as an officer in the American Revolution. There is also a poem at the end ostensibly addressed to David Rittenhouse.

odd.head: Administrative Note
odd.p: This record is superseded by, and included in, B P31. It was marked “internal only” in Dec., 2010 and is being kept in the case that it is needed for future administrative needs.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: St. George Peale was a brother of Charles Willson Peale, and was a clerk of the Maryland Assembly, commissary of military stores.
